DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study is to tests the hypothesis, that N-acetylcysteine (a thiol-antioxidant)improves the exercise training effect on cancer patients that experience weight loss (cachexia) as assessed by muscle mass and function as well as histomorphology.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of an Antioxidant on Cancer-Cachectic Patients Undergoing Exercise Training
DOC.criteria: gastrointestinal or bronchial cancer weight loss of 10% within 6 months sufficient mobility severe pain, steroid therapy, severe internal, muscular, neurological, psychiatric disease, Nacetylcysteine allergy
